str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
Greatly, very much, vehemently. Adverb from megas; much.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To thrive or flourish again, revive. From ana and thallo; to revive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) I think, (b) I think, judge, (c) I direct the mind to, seek for, (d) I observe, (e) I care for.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I think, (b) I think, judge, (c) I direct the mind to, seek for, (d) I observe, (e) I care for.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

word: you had no opportunity [to show it].
parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To be without a suitable opportunity. From a compound of a and kairos; to be inopportune, i.e. To fail of a proper occasion.
